intro: Pedicularis mussotii var. mussotii, commonly known as the Mussot's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in rocky and mountainous habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive spurred shape that attracts specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
